items.name: Ease
items.summary:
An easing function type. Easing functions specify the rate of change of
a parameter over time.

items.name: EaseEqualityComparer
items.summary: Compares the equality of two <xref href="Zigurous.Tweening.Ease" data-throw-if-not-resolved="false"></xref> types.

items.name: Equals(Ease, Ease)
items.summary: Compares the equality of two <xref href="Zigurous.Tweening.Ease" data-throw-if-not-resolved="false"></xref> types.

syntax.content: public bool Equals(Ease x, Ease y)

parameters.description: The first ease to compare.
The second ease to compare.

return.description: True if the two ease types are equal.

items.name: GetHashCode(Ease)
items.summary: Returns the hash code for a specified <xref href="Zigurous.Tweening.Ease" data-throw-if-not-resolved="false"></xref> type.

parameters.description: The ease to get the hash code for.

return.description: The hash code for the ease.

items.name: EaseExtensions
items.summary: Extension methods for <xref href="Zigurous.Tweening.Ease" data-throw-if-not-resolved="false"></xref>.

items.name: ValueAt(Ease, Single)
items.summary: Returns the f(x) value using the ease function.

syntax.content: public static float ValueAt(this Ease ease, float x)

parameters.description: The ease function type.
The x-axis value to evaluate.

return.description: The interpolated value.

items.name: EaseFunction.TimingCurve
items.summary:
A function delegate that returns the value along a timing curve
given the x-axis value, i.e., f(x).

parameters.description: The x-axis number to evaluate.

return.description: The y-axis value of the curve at the given x-axis value.

items.name: EaseFunction
items.summary:
Timing functions for every ease type. Easing functions specify the rate
of change of a parameter over time.

return.description: The y-axis value of the curve at the given x-axis value.

items.name: Interpolation
items.summary: Functions for interpolating values.

items.name: Lerp(Single, Single, Single, Boolean)
items.summary: Linearly interpolates between a and b by t.

syntax.content: public static float Lerp(float a, float b, float t, bool snapping = false)

parameters.description: The start value.
The end value.
The interpolation value between the start and end value.
Snaps the interpolated value to the nearest whole number.

return.description: The interpolated value between the start and end value.

items.name: Lerp(Double, Double, Single, Boolean)
items.summary: Linearly interpolates between a and b by t.

syntax.content: public static double Lerp(double a, double b, float t, bool snapping = false)

parameters.description: The start value.
The end value.
The interpolation value between the start and end value.
Snaps the interpolated value to the nearest whole number.

return.description: The interpolated value between the start and end value.

return.description: The interpolated value between the start and end value.

items.name: LoopType
items.summary: A type of loop style.

items.name: Restart
items.summary: Restarts the tween from the beginning after it ends.

items.name: RestartWithDelay
items.summary:
Restarts the tween from the beginning after it ends. If the tween
has a delay it will be delayed again each loop.

items.name: PingPong
items.summary:
Plays the tween forwards then backwards then forwards then
backwards, etc.

items.name: PingPongWithDelay
items.summary:
Plays the tween forwards then backwards then forwards then
backwards, etc.  If the tween has a delay it will be delayed again
each loop.

items.name: PropertyChaining
items.summary:
Provides method chaining for tweens. This allows multiple properties to
be assigned in a single statement without requiring a variable to store
the intermediate results.

items.name: SetTarget<T>(T, Component)
items.summary:
Sets the id of the tween to the target component so the tween can be
retrieved and destroyed based on that target.

syntax.content:
public static T SetTarget<T>(this T tween, Component target)
    where T : Tween

parameters.description: The tween to assign the value to.
The target component.

return.description: The tween itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: SetTarget<T>(T, GameObject)
items.summary:
Sets the id of the tween to the target game object so the tween can
be retrieved and destroyed based on that game object.

syntax.content:
public static T SetTarget<T>(this T tween, GameObject target)
    where T : Tween

parameters.description: The tween to assign the value to.
The target component.

return.description: The tween itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: SetId<T>(T, Int32)
items.summary: Sets the id of the tween to the given value.

syntax.content:
public static T SetId<T>(this T tween, int id)
    where T : Tween

parameters.description: The tween to assign the value to.
The id to set.

return.description: The tween itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: SetSceneIndex<T>(T, Int32)
items.summary: Sets the scene index of the tween to the given value.

syntax.content:
public static T SetSceneIndex<T>(this T tween, int index)
    where T : Tween

parameters.description: The tween to assign the value to.
The scene index to set.

return.description: The tween itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: SetEase<T>(T, Ease)
items.summary: Sets the ease of the tween to the given value.

syntax.content:
public static T SetEase<T>(this T tween, Ease ease)
    where T : Tween

parameters.description: The tween to assign the value to.
The ease to set.

return.description: The tween itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: SetDuration<T>(T, Single)
items.summary: Sets the duration of the tween to the given value.

syntax.content:
public static T SetDuration<T>(this T tween, float duration)
    where T : Tween

parameters.description: The tween to assign the value to.
The duration to set.

return.description: The tween itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: SetDelay<T>(T, Single)
items.summary: Sets the delay of the tween to the given value.

syntax.content:
public static T SetDelay<T>(this T tween, float delay)
    where T : Tween

parameters.description: The tween to assign the value to.
The delay to set.

return.description: The tween itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: SetLoops<T>(T, Int32, LoopType)
items.summary: Sets the number of loops of the tween to the given value.

syntax.content:
public static T SetLoops<T>(this T tween, int loops, LoopType loopType = LoopType.Restart)
    where T : Tween

parameters.description: The tween to assign the value to.
The number of loops to set.
The type of loop style to set.

return.description: The tween itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: SetReversed<T>(T, Boolean)
items.summary: Sets the tween to play in reverse.

syntax.content:
public static T SetReversed<T>(this T tween, bool reversed = true)
    where T : Tween

parameters.description: The tween to assign the value to.
True if the tween is to be played in reverse.

return.description: The tween itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: SetSnapping<T>(T, Boolean)
items.summary: Sets the tween to snap interpolated values to whole numbers.

syntax.content:
public static T SetSnapping<T>(this T tween, bool snapping = true)
    where T : Tween

parameters.description: The tween to assign the value to.
True if interpolated values should be snapped to whole numbers.

return.description: The tween itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: SetRecyclable<T>(T, Boolean)
items.summary: Sets the tween to be recycled after being completed.

syntax.content:
public static T SetRecyclable<T>(this T tween, bool recyclable)
    where T : Tween

parameters.description: The tween to assign the value to.
True if the tween is to be recycled.

return.description: The tween itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: SetAutoStart<T>(T, Boolean)
items.summary: Sets the tween to auto start after being initialized.

syntax.content:
public static T SetAutoStart<T>(this T tween, bool autoStart)
    where T : Tween

parameters.description: The tween to assign the value to.
True if the tween is to be started automatically.

return.description: The tween itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: SetAutoKill<T>(T, Boolean)
items.summary: Sets the tween to auto kill after being completed.

syntax.content:
public static T SetAutoKill<T>(this T tween, bool autoKill)
    where T : Tween

parameters.description: The tween to assign the value to.
True if the tween is to be killed automatically.

return.description: The tween itself to allow for chaining.

The callback to invoke.

items.summary: Sets the callback to invoke when the tween is looped.

syntax.content:
public static T OnLoop<T>(this T tween, TweenCallback callback)

The callback to invoke.

items.summary: Sets the callback to invoke when the tween is completed.

public static T OnComplete<T>(this T tween, TweenCallback callback)

The callback to invoke.

items.name: Sequence
items.summary:
Plays a sequence of tweens in order. The sequence itself maintains its
own state and can be controlled the same as any other tween.

items.name: currentIndex
items.summary: The index of the current tween in the sequence being played (Read only).

items.name: tweens
items.summary: The tweens contained in the sequence (Read only).

items.name: activeTween
items.summary: The tween in the sequence currently being played (Read only).

items.name: Sequence()
items.summary: Creates a new tween sequence.

items.name: Play()
items.summary:
Plays the tween sequence, whether starting for the first time or
resuming from a stopped state.

return.description: The sequence itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: Append(Tween)
items.summary: Adds a new tween to the end of the sequence.

parameters.description: The tween to add.

return.description: The sequence itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: Prepend(Tween)
items.summary: Adds a new tween to the beginning of the sequence.

parameters.description: The tween to add.

return.description: The sequence itself to allow for chaining.

items.name: Settings
items.summary: Properties for changing global tweening settings.

items.name: defaultEase
items.summary: The default Ease assigned to every tween.

items.name: defaultDuration
items.summary: The default amount of seconds a tween takes to complete.

items.name: defaultDelay
items.summary: The default amount of seconds before every tween starts.

items.name: overshoot
items.summary: The overshoot value used in easing functions.

items.name: initialCapacity
items.summary:
The initial amount of tweens memory is allocated for when the system
starts. Additional memory will be allocated as needed.

items.name: autoStart
items.summary:
Automatically starts tweens after being created, by default.
This setting can be overridden by individual tweens.

items.name: autoKill
items.summary:
Automatically kills tweens after being completed, by default.
This setting can be overridden by individual tweens.

items.name: recyclable
items.summary:
Keeps tweens in memory to be re-used after being killed, by default.
This setting can be overridden by individual tweens.

items.name: SetDefaultEase(Ease)
items.summary: Sets the default Ease assigned to every tween.

parameters.description: The Ease to set as the default.

items.name: SetDefaultDuration(Single)
items.summary: Sets the default amount of seconds a tween takes to complete.

parameters.description: The amount of seconds to set as the default.

items.name: SetDefaultDelay(Single)
items.summary: Sets the default amount of seconds before every tween starts.

parameters.description: The amount of seconds to set as the default.

items.name: SetOvershoot(Single)
items.summary: Sets the overshoot value used in easing functions.

parameters.description: The overshoot value to set.

items.name: SetInitialCapacity(Int32)
items.summary:
Sets the initial amount of tweens memory is allocated for when the
system starts. Additional memory will be allocated as needed.

parameters.description: The initial capacity to set.

items.name: SetAutoStart(Boolean)
items.summary:
Sets whether to automatically start tweens after being created,
by default. This setting can be overridden by individual tweens.

parameters.description: Whether to automatically start tweens after being created.

items.name: SetAutoKill(Boolean)
items.summary:
Sets whether to automatically kills tweens after being completed,
by default. This setting can be overridden by individual tweens.

parameters.description: Whether to automatically kill tweens after being completed.

items.name: SetRecyclable(Boolean)
items.summary:
Sets whether to keep tweens in memory to be re-used after being
killed, by default. This setting can be overridden by individual tweens.

parameters.description: Whether to allow tweens to be recycled.

items.name: Tween
items.summary: The base class of every tween.

items.name: id
items.summary:
An identifier that can be used to distinguish the tween from others.
This is not explicitly required nor is it necessarily unique. The id
is often used to identify which object the parameter being animated
belongs to, and often that object is animating multiple parameters.

items.name: sceneIndex
items.summary:
The index of the scene that contains the object being animated by
the tween. The is used to kill the tween when the scene is unloaded.

items.name: state
items.summary: The animation state of the tween.

items.name: IsPlaying
items.summary: Whether the tween is playing.

items.name: IsStopped
items.summary: Whether the tween is stopped.

items.name: IsComplete
items.summary: Whether the tween is complete.

items.name: IsKilled
items.summary: Whether the tween is killed.

items.name: ease
items.summary: The easing function type used by the tween to animate values.

items.name: duration
items.summary: The amount of seconds the tween takes to complete.

items.name: elapsed
items.summary: The amount of seconds that have elapsed since the tween started.

items.name: PercentComplete
items.summary: The tween's percentage of completion.

items.name: delay
items.summary:
The amount of seconds the tween waits before playing after being
started.

items.name: delayElapsed
items.summary:
The amount of seconds that have elapsed during the tween's delayed
state, when applicable.

items.name: IsDelayed
items.summary:
Whether the tween is currently in a delayed state, i.e., the tween
has been started but the elapsed time has not exceeded the delay
duration.

items.name: loops
items.summary:
The number of times the tween loops. A value of -1 will loop the
tween infinitely.

items.name: loopType
items.summary: The style in which the tween loops.

items.name: iterations
items.summary: The number of times the tween has completed.

items.name: reversed
items.summary:
Animates from the end value to the start value as opposed to
animating from the start value to the end value like normal.

items.name: snapping
items.summary: Smoothly snaps all interpolated values to whole numbers.

items.name: recyclable
items.summary: Keeps the tween in memory to be re-used after being killed.

items.name: autoStart
items.summary: Automatically starts the tween after being created.

items.name: autoKill
items.summary: Automatically kills the tween after being completed.

items.name: onUpdate
items.summary:
The callback invoked every time the tween is updated, i.e., any time
the parameter being animated is changed.

items.name: onStart
items.summary: The callback invoked when the tween is started.

items.name: onStop
items.summary: The callback invoked when the tween is stopped.

items.name: onLoop
items.summary: The callback invoked when the tween is looped.

items.name: onComplete
items.summary: The callback invoked when the tween is completed.

items.name: onKill
items.summary: The callback invoked when the tween is killed.

items.name: Tween()
items.summary: Creates a new tween object.

items.name: Animate()
items.summary: Animates the parameter being tweened to the current state.

items.name: Play()
items.summary:
Plays the tween, whether starting for the first time or resuming
from a stopped state.

items.name: Stop()
items.summary: Stops the tween if currently being played.

items.name: Complete()
items.summary: Completes the tween, jumping to the end value.

items.name: Kill()
items.summary:
Kills the tween in its place, preventing any further state changes
or changes to the parameter being animated.

items.name: Restart()
items.summary: Restarts the tween as along as it has not been killed.

items.name: TweenCallback
items.summary:
A function delegate that can be invoked during various tween events
and/or state changes.

items.name: Tweener<T>
items.summary:
A tween that animates a parameter over time from a start value to an end
value.

typeParameters.description: The type of the parameter to tween.

items.name: interpolater
items.summary:
The function that interpolates values between the tween's start and
end value.

items.name: getter
items.summary:
The function that gets the current value of the parameter being
tweened.

items.name: setter
items.summary: The function that sets a new value of the parameter being tweened.

items.name: startValue
items.summary: The initial value of the parameter at the start of the tween.

items.name: endValue
items.summary: The desired value of the parameter at the end of the tween.

items.name: Tweener()
items.summary: Creates a new tweener.

items.name: TweenGetter<T>
items.summary: A function delegate that gets the current value of a parameter.

return.description: The current value of the parameter.

items.name: TweenSetter<T>
items.summary: A function delegate that sets a new value of a parameter.

parameters.description: The new value of the parameter.

items.name: TweenState
items.summary: A type of animation state that a tween can be in.

items.name: Ready
items.summary: The tween has been initialized and is ready to be played.

items.name: Playing
items.summary: The tween is currently playing and receiving updates.

items.name: Stopped
items.summary: The tween is currently stopped/paused.

items.name: Complete
items.summary: The tween has completed but not yet killed.

items.name: Killed
items.summary: The tween is killed, making it no longer usable.

items.name: Interpolater<T>
items.summary: A function delegate that interpolates the value between a and b by t.

syntax.content: public delegate T Interpolater<T>(T a, T b, float t, bool snapping);

parameters.description: The start value.
The end value.
The interpolation value between the start and end value.
Snaps the interpolated value to the nearest whole number.

return.description: The interpolated value between the start and end value.

items.name: Tweening
items.summary: The primary interface to create, control, and manage tweens.

items.name: count
items.summary:
The number of tweens currently alive. This includes tweens that have
been recycled and are not currently active (Read only).

items.name: activeCount
items.summary: The number of tweens that are currently alive and active (Read only).

items.name: To(TweenGetter<Single>, TweenSetter<Single>, Single, Single)
items.summary:
Creates a tween that animates a parameter to a given end value over
a set duration.

syntax.content: public static Tween To(TweenGetter<float> getter, TweenSetter<float> setter, float endValue, float duration)

parameters.description: The function that gets the current value of the parameter.
The function that sets a new value of the parameter.
The end value of the parameter.
The duration of the tween.

return.description: A new tween that animates the parameter.

return.description: A new tween that animates the parameter.

items.name: Sequence()
items.summary: Creates a new, empty tween sequence.

return.description: The new tween sequence.

items.name: Sequence(Tween[])
items.summary: Creates a new tween sequence of the given tweens.

syntax.content: public static Sequence Sequence(params Tween[] tweens)

parameters.description: The tweens to add to the sequence.

return.description: The new tween sequence.

items.name: PlayAll()
items.summary: Plays all active tweens.

items.name: Play(Int32)
items.summary: Plays any alive tween that matches the given id.

parameters.description: The id of the tween(s) to play.

items.name: Play<T>(T)
items.summary: Plays any alive tween that is animating the given target object.

syntax.content:
public static void Play<T>(T target)
    where T : class

parameters.description: The target object to play the tweens of.

typeParameters.description: The type of the target object.

items.name: StopAll()
items.summary: Stops all active tweens.

items.name: Stop(Int32)
items.summary: Stops any alive tween that matches the given id.

parameters.description: The id of the tween(s) to stop.

items.name: Stop<T>(T)
items.summary: Stops any alive tween that is animating the given target object.

syntax.content:
public static void Stop<T>(T target)
    where T : class

parameters.description: The target object to stop the tweens of.

typeParameters.description: The type of the target object.

items.name: RestartAll()
items.summary: Restarts all active tweens.

items.name: Restart(Int32)
items.summary: Restarts any alive tween that matches the given id.

parameters.description: The id of the tween(s) to restart.

items.name: Restart<T>(T)
items.summary: Restarts any alive tween that is animating the given target object.

syntax.content:
public static void Restart<T>(T target)
    where T : class

parameters.description: The target object to restart the tweens of.

typeParameters.description: The type of the target object.

items.name: CompleteAll()
items.summary: Completes all active tweens.

items.name: Complete(Int32)
items.summary: Completes any alive tween that matches the given id.

parameters.description: The id of the tween(s) to complete.

items.name: Complete<T>(T)
items.summary: Completes any alive tween that is animating the given target object.

syntax.content:
public static void Complete<T>(T target)
    where T : class

parameters.description: The target object to complete the tweens of.

typeParameters.description: The type of the target object.

items.name: KillAll(Boolean)
items.summary:
Kills all active tweens. Optionally, the tweens can be completed
before being killed.

syntax.content: public static void KillAll(bool complete = false)

parameters.description: Whether to complete the tweens before being killed.

items.name: Kill(Int32, Boolean)
items.summary:
Kills any alive tween that matches the given id. Optionally, the
tweens can be completed before being killed.

syntax.content: public static void Kill(int id, bool complete = false)

parameters.description: The id of the tween(s) to kill.
Whether to complete the tweens before being killed.
